noun.description: An act, statement, or gift that is intended to show gratitude, respect, or admiration.
examples: the video is a tribute to the musicals of the 40s
a symposium organized to pay tribute to Darwin

noun.description: Payment made periodically by one state or ruler to another, especially as a sign of dependence.
examples: the king had at his disposal plunder and tribute amassed through warfare

noun.description: A proportion of ore or its equivalent, paid to a miner for his work, or to the owner or lessor of a mine.

origin: Late Middle English (in tribute (sense 2)): from Latin tributum, neuter past participle (used as a noun) of tribuere assign (originally divide between tribes), from tribus tribe.
